name: Vegetable Kadai
history: Vegetable Kadai is a popular Indian dish known for its rich and aromatic gravy. It's traditionally cooked in a 'Kadai,' a type of wok commonly used in Indian cooking.
description: Vegetable Kadai is a vibrant and flavorful curry made with a mix of vegetables, cooked in a spicy tomato-based sauce and garnished with fresh herbs. It's a versatile dish that pairs well with rice or Indian breads.

instructions.title: Prepare the Vegetables
instructions.description: Start by washing all the vegetables. Chop the cauliflower into florets, dice the carrots and bell peppers, and chop the green beans and onions. Keep the vegetables aside.

instructions.title: Cook the Vegetables
instructions.description: Heat oil in a kadai or wok. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add the chopped onions and sautÃ© until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and stir for a minute.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Vegetables
instructions.description: Add turmeric, coriander, red chili powder, and salt to the onions. Mix well. Add the chopped vegetables and stir. Cook for about 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.

instructions.title: Simmer the Curry
instructions.description: Add the chopped tomatoes and a little water to the kadai. Cover and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are cooked but still hold their shape.

instructions.title: Add Final Spices
instructions.description: Sprinkle garam masala and Kasuri methi over the curry. Stir well. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish the Vegetable Kadai with chopped fresh cilantro. Serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

tips: Adjust the amount of chili powder to suit your spice preference.
The dish can be made more flavorful by adding a bit of lemon juice or amchur (mango powder) at the end.
variations: For a protein-rich version, add paneer or tofu.
Experiment with different vegetables like mushrooms or peas.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until warm.

presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish for an authentic presentation.
Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh cilantro and a side of lemon wedges.
